title: ISF MLA Nawshad Siddique named in FIR in Bhangar’s anti-Waqf act protest violence
content: Siddique said that “unarmed and peaceful” protesters were arrested. “We abide by the law, but we will not let this slide,” Mr. Siddique said

title: Continue existing 41% devolution of tax revenues to States: BJP leaders
content: Continue the revenue deficit grant for States having the post-tax devolution revenue deficit as per the existing parameters, request 20-Point Programme Chairman Lanka Dinakar and Jammalamadugu MLA Ch. Adinaryana Reddy to to 16th Finance Commission Chairman

title: West Godavari police win top prize at crime detection awards
content: Sri Satya Sai police solve child murder; Vizianagaram cops bust digital fraud, recover cash and jewellery; Guntur police get consolation prize

title: Nanguneri teen, who was hacked by schoolmates in 2023, attacked again
content: Police suspect that the attackers might be linked to those who orchestrated the attack on the boy in August 2023 or the same group involved in the earlier attack.

title: ‘Bifurcation blues’ still weigh heavy on A.P., Naidu tells 16th Finance Commission
content: Division of assets worth ₹39,191 crore belonging to 142 institutions is yet to be completed even as 10 years have passed  the bifurcation, says the Chief Minister

title: Devolution of shares: A.P. wants ‘income distance’ weightage to be reduced to 30%, says Finance Commission Chairman
content: The Finance Commission will make decisions after doing a thorough assessment of the States’ requirements, says Panagariya

title: Tension mounts in Etah as Dalit alleges assault after vandalisation of Kalyan Singh’s statue
content: Some members of the Dalit community have also alleged that anti-social elements entered their homes and assaulted the residents, including women and children

title: Samagra Shiksha invites applications for admissions to Class 1 under Right to Education Act
content: State to fill 25% Class 1 seats in private schools under RTE Act from April 28 to May 15 for 2025-26 academic year

title: Woman, son ‘beat three puppies to death’; six more accused of defanging dog with pliers
content: Three puppies were allegedly beaten to death in M.P.; the cruelty continued in a neighbouring village where another dog was defanged with pliers

title: People of T.N. no longer want DMK in power, voter sentiment strongly favouring a change, says Nainar Nagenthran
content: Newly elected BJP Tamil Nadu president Nainar Nagenthran hits out at the DMK government for ‘unfulfilled’ poll promises and deteriorating law and order in State, among other issues. He further says that the anti-incumbency factor in the State in the last four years has been over 20%

title: Protesting attack on Hindus in Murshidabad, BJP MLAs demand West Bengal CM‘s resignation
content: LoP asks Calcutta HC for permission to visit riot-hit areas; seeks NIA probe; CM announces ₹10 lakh compensation for kin of three people killed in violence; Congress says CM must visit affected areas

title: Trump's tariff blitz on China may have an unexpected winner: India
content: Amidst the trade tensions between the US and China, India emerges as a key player. Companies like Apple are shifting production to India. This shift is due to tariffs and India's conciliatory trade stance. The Indian government is providing incentives to boost manufacturing. While challenges remain, India is well-positioned to benefit from the global supply chain shifts.

title: Key points raised by SC during landmark hearing
content: The Supreme Court addressed petitions against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, focusing on 'waqf by user' and non-Muslim board inclusion. The court questioned disallowing 'waqf by user' due to document challenges, recognising its historical validity. Concerns were raised about violence during protests against the Act, with the court emphasizing that pending legal matters should not incite unrest.

title: Chess v checkers: US and China blunder into stalemate
content: Pride and stubbornness are hindering the US and China from resolving their trade dispute, impacting global commerce. The US insists China initiate talks, while China demands respect, leading to a stalemate. Both countries are seeking alternative trade partners as tensions rise, with nations like India caught in the middle, and the US scrutinizing transshipments via third countries to evade tariffs.

title: Pentagon orders to make nuclear triggers superfast
content: A recent Pentagon directive mandates nuclear weapon delivery within two minutes of message receipt, coinciding with the accelerated development of the B61-13 bomb, 24 times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb. This directive, revealed in an unclassified document, aims to expedite nuclear command and control operations.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Ross Gerber said in an interview recently that Elon Musk “doesn’t care” about the electric car manufacturer. He also defended his criticism after a backlash from retail investors.

title: Big blow for RR! Sanju Samson retires hurt mid-innings vs DC
content: Rajasthan Royals faced a setback as captain Sanju Samson retired hurt during their IPL 2025 match against Delhi Capitals after experiencing rib pain while batting. Samson, who had scored a quick 31, walked off the field, casting doubt on RR's campaign. Earlier, Delhi Capitals posted 188/5, with contributions from Axar Patel, Tristan Stubbs, and Abhishek Porel.

title: 'Wait for greater clarity': US Fed to hold off altering interest rates
content: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell announced a hold on interest rate changes, awaiting clarity on President Trump's economic policies. Uncertainty surrounds immigration, tax policy, regulation, and trade tariffs. While tariffs are expected to cause short-lived inflation and slower growth, opinions diverge among Fed officials. Some, like Waller, downplay long-term tariff impacts, while others prioritize inflation control.

title: Deportation flights: Trump officials may be held in criminal contempt
content: A US district judge has found probable cause to hold Trump administration officials in criminal contempt for defying court orders. These orders had blocked the deportation of alleged Venezuelan gang members under the Alien Enemies Act. Despite the judge's mid-March ruling, the government proceeded with deportations to El Salvador, leading to political and legal backlash.

title: Trump is 'escalating' Harvard University fight; Elon Musk 'joins in' & picks side
content: A clash has erupted between Donald Trump and Harvard University over governance, hiring, and admissions, including demands to shut diversity offices. After Harvard rejected these demands, citing constitutional rights, the White House froze $2.2 billion in federal funding. Elon Musk has weighed in, supporting Trump's call to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

title: China willing to begin trade talks with US, but sets several riders
content: China is ready to restart trade talks with the US, demanding respect, a consistent trade policy, and attention to its concerns on sanctions and Taiwan. Beijing seeks a lead negotiator with Trump's full support. This comes after a tariff hike by the US following China's block on Boeing purchases. China also condemned VP Vance's remarks about "Chinese peasants" as ignorant.

title: US Vice President JD Vance to visit India, meeting with PM Modi on agenda
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, will visit Italy and India from April 18-24. In India, Vance will meet PM Modi to discuss economic and geopolitical priorities amidst ongoing tariff discussions. This visit, which includes stops in New Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra, marks Vance's second international trip as Vice President.

title: Samson warned, Sandeep's record over: Rare incidents in DC vs RR
content: The Delhi Capitals vs Rajasthan Royals IPL 2025 match featured unusual incidents. An umpire intervened when Sanju Samson stood too deep to Jofra Archer. Sandeep Sharma then bowled an eventful 11-ball final over, conceding 19 runs due to multiple extras, shifting momentum to Delhi. Sharma joined the list of bowlers with the most deliveries in an IPL over.

title: What went wrong after Elon Musk ‘proposed’ Tiffany Fong to have his child
content: Crypto influencer Tiffany Fong gained fame after Elon Musk followed her on Twitter. Musk reportedly asked Fong to have his child, which she declined. Fong shared this with friends, including Ashley St. Clair. Musk, upset by the lack of discretion, unfollowed Fong. This led to a decline in her followers and earnings. Musk has thirteen children with three women.

title: Explainer: Why Trump has slapped 245% tariff on China
content: Donald Trump has placed high tariffs on Chinese goods. This is in response to China's control over minerals. These minerals are important for many industries. The US relies on China for these resources. Trump's move aims to protect US security. China says it will take action. The US is working to build its own mineral industry.

title: 'Hard to look past IPL': Billings on comparing it with PSL in Pakistan
content: England's Sam Billings acknowledged the Indian Premier League (IPL) as the leading T20 tournament globally, surpassing competitions like the Pakistan Super League (PSL). While praising the talent in Pakistan cricket, Billings emphasised the importance of structured thinking for consistent success. He cherishes the opportunity to play cricket worldwide and entertain fans.

title: Five military personnel honoured with MacGregor memorial medals
content: The award celebrates outstanding contributions in military reconnaissance, exploration and adventure for the years 2023 and 2024

title: Former diplomat declines Trinamool Congress MP’s offer to settle defamation suit in Delhi High Court
content: Former U.N. Assistant Secretary General Lakshmi Murdeshwar Puri refused the settlement offer, with her counsel contending that Saket Gokhale had abused her without any basis

title: Tiger kills seven-year-old boy at Ranthambore National Park
content: The forest officials launched a rescue operation and located the tiger with the corpse deep inside the forest

title: Northeastern region is the gateway to Southeast Asia, says Jaishankar
content: Fortnight after Muhammad Yunus described the region as ‘landlocked’, External Affairs Minister says the northeast is at the ‘heart of many key Indian policies’

title: Remove caste references in school, college names, orders Madras High Court
content: The judgement was passed while disposing of a batch of writ petitions filed by South Indian Senguntha Mahajana Sangam, Tiruchengode Vatta Kongu Velalar Sangam and The Poor Educational Fund.

title: U.P. Muslim body asks Muslims to distance themselves from Vijay
content: Accusing the actor as anti-Muslim to the core, by portraying Muslims as terrorist in some of his films, Mr. Razvi added Mr. Vijay aimed to tarnish the image of Muslims hence it is necessary for Muslims to maintain gap with the political party, the actor formed and should not extend support

title: CM throws his weight behind Divya S. Iyer who came under fire for lauding K.K. Ragesh’s election as CPI(M)‘s Kannur district secretary
content: The IAS officer had created political controversy and, later, came under Opposition fire for lauding K.K. Ragesh, Mr. Vijayan’s political secretary, for his election as the district secretary of the CPI(M) in Kannur

title: Mahadev App case: ED raids over 50 locations, including EaseMyTrip co-founder residence
content: The ED has earlier claimed that its probe revealed the involvement of several top politicians and bureaucrats from Chhattisgarh and that the proceeds of crime were about ₹6,000 crore in the case

title: T.N. restrains govt. staff from writing books criticising State policies
content: Conduct rules amended to restrict public servants from accepting remuneration or royalty from publishers

title: Opposition slams Mahayuti govt. over alleged cuts to Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Aaditya Thackeray mocked the ruling coalition’s credibility, calling it a “demonic alliance” propped up by the Election Commission’s “blessings”

title: Licence of Madhya Pradesh hospital suspended following ‘fake doctor’ row
content: The Mission Hospital in Damoh has been instructed to not admit any new patients and to shift its patients to the district hospital, or discharge eligible patients within the next three days

title: Bat size row: Narine, Nortje fail 'gauge test' in PBKS vs KKR game
content: IPL-2025 has seen increased scrutiny of bat sizes, with on-field inspections now common. Sunil Narine and Anrich Nortje of KKR recently failed the gauge test, highlighting the BCCI's efforts to ensure fair play. While some, like Daniel Vettori, downplay the impact, bat manufacturers suggest alternative ways to balance the game, rather than solely focusing on bat dimensions.

title: BluSmart users stranded as firm suspends ride-hailing operations: Report
content: BluSmart is experiencing widespread booking issues across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai due to its strategic shift to integrate its EV fleet with Uber's platform. This transition follows financial difficulties, including high cash burn rates and regulatory action against Gensol Engineering, linked to BluSmart's co-founder. The company has already scaled down its services significantly amid ongoing scrutiny and financial instability.

title: Detroit Red Wings and New Jersey Devils reveal re-shuffled lineups
content: The Detroit Red Wings and New Jersey Devils face off in a game on Wednesday night, with new lineups and several absentees. The Red Wings are using the final quarter of the season to give younger players more ice time, while the Devils aim to polish their game before the playoffs. The game will feature a potential return of star defenseman Dougie Hamilton, while the Red Wings are in development mode.

title: Waqf case: Will you allow Muslims to be part of Hindu trusts, SC asks Centre
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Centre on potentially allowing Muslims in Hindu religious trusts during a hearing on petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025. Concerns were raised about 'waqf by user' and the Act's implications on long-standing Islamic practices. The court is considering whether to hear the matter or refer it to a high court, with petitioners arguing the Act's provisions are unconstitutional.

title: 'We perhaps got too casual': Axar Patel reflects on DC’s loss to MI
content: Delhi Capitals' captain Axar Patel acknowledged complacency after their loss to Mumbai Indians. He highlighted the middle phase as a concern. DC remain unchanged for the match against Rajasthan Royals. Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals' captain, chose to field after winning the toss. Both teams aim for victory in their ongoing IPL 2025 campaign at Arun Jaitley Stadium.

title: SC rejects staying Waqf law, seeks Centre's reply on pleas
content: The Supreme Court addressed petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, raising concerns about the removal of 'waqf by user' and the inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf boards. The court questioned the practicality of requiring registered deeds for old mosques and sought clarification from the Centre on non-Muslim representation.

title: 'There was an argument …': Rohit on dropping himself for Sydney Test
content: Rohit Sharma disclosed a disagreement with team management regarding his decision to withdraw from the Sydney Test during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Citing poor form, Rohit felt it was best for the team to allow a more prepared player, like Shubman Gill, to take his place. This decision, though met with resistance, reflects Rohit's team-first leadership philosophy.

title: Kamra row: HC grants interim relief from arrest in 'traitor' joke case
content: The Bombay high court has granted comedian Kunal Kamra interim relief from arrest in the "traitor" joke case, following an FIR filed against him for allegedly referring to Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde as a "traitor.

title: 'What did he expect?'- Yankees fire back after Soto remarked on Aaron Judge
content: Juan Soto is off to a sluggish start with the Mets, and his recent statement about missing Aaron Judge made waves. Although some Yankees insiders condemned his decision to depart, others, such as Aaron Judge, were supportive. Juan Soto has time yet to redeem himself and recover this season.

title: 'Working against law': Kharge attacks BJP over National Herald case
content: Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the ED's chargesheet against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, accusing the BJP of political vendetta and misuse of law. Congress plans nationwide protests, alleging the chargesheet is a diversion from economic issues. BJP leaders dismiss the allegations, asserting the law will take its course and accusing Congress of corruption and subservience to the Gandhi family.

title: Steinfeld & Jordan’s bond in new photos leaves fans confused and curious
content: Hailee Steinfeld and Michael B. Jordan are promoting their new movie. Pictures of them in London are circulating online. Fans are speculating about their relationship. Some fans are mentioning Josh Allen, Steinfeld's fiance. Steinfeld has praised Allen in interviews. The actress looked stunning in a black and white dress. Jordan looked handsome in a black outfit.

title: 'Harvard a joke': Trump rants against 'woke birdbrains' teaching 'hate'
content: Donald Trump has once again targeted Harvard University. He termed it a 'joke' and unworthy of federal funds. Trump criticized Harvard's hiring choices. He mentioned Bill de Blasio and Lori Lightfoot. Trump accused the university of employing 'woke' and 'radical left' individuals. He also referenced the plagiarism allegations against Harvard's president.

title: Why Google has removed 247.4 million ads in India
content: Google suspended 2.9 million advertiser accounts and removed 247.4 million ads in India in 2024 due to policy violations. Globally, over 39.2 million accounts were suspended and 5.1 billion ads were taken down. The company implemented over 50 improvements to its LLMs and suspended 700,000 accounts, leading to a 90% drop in scam ad reports.

title: ICAI CA May admit card 2025 released for Intermediate, Foundation exam
content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has released the admit cards for the CA Intermediate and Final May 2025 exams on its eServices portal. Candidates can log in using their SSP ID and password to download the hall tickets, which include crucial exam details. Foundation-level admit cards will be released in late April.

title: Deepika and Ranveer's new house, Sagarika Ghatge's baby boy: Top 5 news
content: Mithun Chakraborty praises Prabhas. Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's new house is almost ready. Zaheer Khan and Sagarika Ghatge welcome a baby boy. Sharvari Wagh will star opposite Ranveer Singh in Don 3. Soha Ali Khan supports Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's decision to keep Raha away from the public eye. These stories are creating buzz in the entertainment world.

title: 'No romance, just...': Elon Musk's crazy rules for his baby mamas
content: Elon Musk doesn’t have children. He has a legion. That’s what he calls his sprawling brood, borrowing the term from Roman military units known for conquest and expansion. The mission? To out-breed the collapse of Western civilisation. The method? Unclear. But one text from Musk to a baby mama suggests “we will need to use surrogates” to “reach legion-level before the apocalypse.” As you do.

title: Gold records new high at Rs 98K, soaring more than Rs 1,500 in one day
content: Gold prices have soared to unprecedented levels, reaching Rs 98,100 per 10 grams in the national capital, fueled by escalating trade tensions between the US and China. This surge is further supported by a weakened US dollar and positive outlooks from major banks, citing inflows into gold-backed ETFs and sustained central bank buying.

title: Can Muslims be members in Hindu endowments, Supreme Court asks Centre in Waqf law challenge
content: Chief Justice of India-led three-judge Bench refers to the communal violence in West Bengal over the 2025 Act as “very disturbing”

title: 3 agents held for attempting to send a Punjab resident to Canada on a fake passport
content: Police have registered an FIR against all three accused and are further probing their financial transactions and exploring their involvement in similar immigration frauds

title: Mehbooba expresses concern over Murshidabad violence
content: She said as a community we must channelise our energies constructively to upholding our constitutional rights through peaceful and lawful means

title: CM accuses IUML of letting down the national cause against the “anti-Muslim” Waqf Act 2025
content: CM says IUML-controlled Cannanore District Muslim Educational Association leased Waqf land from the Juma Masjid authorities in 1967. Later, it claimed that the land was a private bequest and not Waqf as per the original lease agreement

title: ED working as a BJP wing, says Bihar Congress in-charge Krishna Allavaru
content: Congress workers stage protest, hurl shoes and slippers at Patna’s ED office after agency’s chargesheet against Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case

title: Worried about ‘decline’ in stand-up quality, RSS cultural wing seeks to ‘reestablish Indian values in comedy’
content: Sanskar Bharti says comedy could be used as a tool for social reform, but is becoming a “shortcut to fame” instead; under the guise of free expression, artists mock religion, national heroes, social practices, it adds

title: Nagpur violence: civic chief apologises to HC over illegal demolitions, claims ignorance of SC guidelines
content: Division Bench grants the State government two weeks to respond, while noting the administration’s overreach

title: Watch: Sunil Narine's bat fails gauge test during IPL match
content: During the IPL match between KKR and PBKS, Sunil Narine's bat failed a live gauge test, highlighting the BCCI's crackdown on oversized bats. Anrich Nortje faced a similar issue later in the game. These mid-match checks, a new protocol, aim to prevent unfair advantages, with several players already scrutinised this season for bat dimensions exceeding ICC regulations.

title: 'Yogi biggest Bhogi': Mamata attacks UP CM for remarks on Waqf protests
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee retaliated against UP CM Yogi Adityanath's criticism of Murshidabad violence, citing the Maha Kumbh stampede and alleged UP encounters. She accused Yogi of being a 'Bhogi' and defended Bengal's freedom of expression.

title: Leaked War Chats: How is Dan Caldwell linked to Trump admin's Signalgate?
content: Caldwell wasn’t the only casualty. Darin Selnick, the Pentagon’s Deputy Chief of Staff and another political appointee, was also placed on administrative leave and removed from the building. According to defense officials, both men had their security credentials suspended pending the outcome of the investigation.

title: CSK mid-season report: Can Dhoni magic turn it around for Chennai?
content: Chennai Super Kings face a tough situation in IPL 2025, sitting at the bottom with only two wins in seven games. While Noor Ahmad and Khaleel Ahmad shine with the ball, the batting struggles, especially with Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury. Rachin Ravindra leads in runs, but the middle order falters.

title: Why are top Indian GMs struggling at Freestyle Chess?
content: Indian chess fans face disappointment as their grandmasters struggle in the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam. Despite Arjun Erigaisi's quarterfinal appearance, Gukesh Dommaraju, Vidit Gujrathi, and Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa failed to advance. Coach Srinath Narayanan believes it's too early to judge, citing the high level of competition and the need for adaptation to the format.

title: CPI leader objects allegations of cow deaths at TTD’s goshala
content: Narayana visits the dairy farm premises in Tirupati and interacts with the officials, staff members, including the animal keepers who closely monitor the developments pertaining to the animal sheds

title: Akhilesh Yadav asks Centre to refrain from interfering in the affairs of States
content: After Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin’s move to form a three-member high-level committee to review the constitutional provisions governing Centre-State relations, the Samajwadi Party leader said autonomy and federalism should be respected

title: Hartal in protest against wildlife attacks total in Athirappilly
content: Three tribespeople were killed within a span of 48 hours in the area in attacks by wild elephants. Shops stayed shut and public and private transport came to a halt across the region

title: Pawar backs aspirants’ demand for more MPSC vacancies
content: NCP(SP) chief Sharad Pawar argued that increasing vacancies would align with the MPSC’s recent decision to raise the qualifying age limit for candidates

title: Call for mass fast to mark 2000th day of public demand to protect Chellanam-Fort Kochi coast
content: Chellanam-Kochi Janakeeya Vedi leaders have appealed to residents of the coastal village to join the hunger strike from wherever they are in the world and to send in pictures and reports of their participation in the mass actio

title: IISR develops light-coloured turmeric
content: The new product with high yield and pleasant aroma comes out after a decade-long research by a team of five scientists

title: State govt. to consider giving 60% incentives to attract industries to backward areas
content: Siddaramaiah promises considering the proposal made by AICC president Mallikarjun Kharge during the inauguration of mega job fair in Kalaburagi

title: Centre, State govt.s using Munambam issue for political gains, says Thangal
content: Says Union Minister for Minority Affairs Kiren Rijiju’s latest statement that the Munambam residents could take legal recourse to address their concerns validated the IUML’s stand

title: Beat patrol to be reintroduced in Kozhikode to combat drug trafficking
content: Preparations are under way in the district to assign beats to police officers who will be collaborating with local residents to step up day-and-night patrol

title: Govt. to withdraw case against those protesting for Royal Road reopening
content: Case was filed against Idukki MP, Kothamangalam MLA, former Kothamangalam bishop, and hundreds of local people

title: Increase vertical devolution share to States, A.P. CM urges 16th Finance Commission team
content: The Finance Commission should increase the current vertical devolution share from 41% to 50%, says Naidu

title: Help us stand today to play a key role in India’s success tomorrow, A.P. Chief Minister Chandrababu  Naidu tells 16th Finance Commission
content: Extend liberal financial assistance considering the State as a special case, he says, adding that the government has set a goal of achieving 15% growth rate; he also explains the need for taking up Godavari–Banakacharla linkage project

title: Mass cancer screening begins in Bhalabhadrapuram village
content: Eight medical teams to screen 10,000 residents for various cancers with a focus on breast and cervical cancer

title: BJP leader alleges swindling of Tulabharam funds
content: The report was hidden with an intention to save the bigwigs, and the temporary staff were either transferred or removed to cover up the issue, alleges G. Bhanuprakash Reddy

title: Ashtamudi to get tourism development project of ₹59 cr.
content: Finance Minister says Kollam has multiple projects that will contribute  significantly to the State’s progress

title: Telangana set to bag ₹29,000 crore renewable energy projects
content: Ecoren Energy proposes ₹27,000 crore renewable energy projects; GPSR Arya intends to set up 15 compressed biogas projects with ₹2,000 crore

title: Kerala Chicken: chilled chicken products to be rolled out next month
content: Mini processing unit has equipment such as killing cone, boiler, and defeathering machine, but is not automated. It has a capacity of 500 birds a day

title: A.P. capital Amaravati gets smart infrastructure push; 14 road work packages under way
content: APCRDA will complete trunk roads in one and a half years and Land Pooling Scheme layout infrastructure in two and a half years, says MA&UD Minister

title: Safe havens: how big tree hollows shelter elusive Nilgiri martens
content: KFRI study reveals that the rare mammal rely on old, hollow trees for survival, highlighting the urgent need to protect these trees

title: Karnataka relaxes age criteria for class 1 admission for 2025-26 to 5 yrs and 5 months
content: Minister Madhu Bangarappa says this relaxation will not be given next year, and the minimum age of 6 years would be strictly implemented

title: ‘Fake’ cardiologist row: Damoh Mission Hospital management booked for forgery
content: As per the FIR seen by The Hindu, the hospital has been accused of forging the signatures of a Jabalpur-based doctor and using forged documents to obtain the cath lab licence through online registration

title: Forest dept. books case against 18, including parish priest
content: Forest officials had demolished a cross erected beside the Neyyassery-Thokkumban road near Thommankuth, which they claim to be reserve forest

title: How Paul Skenes is growing into life as MLB's next megastar
content: Amid the noise that comes with achieving superstar status, the Pirates ace finds himself in the quiet.

title: Duke freshman star Knueppel to enter NBA draft
content: Duke freshman Kon Knueppel announced that he will enter the 2025 NBA draft and forgo his remaining college eligibility.

title: Trae tossed for 'making mockery of game' in loss
content: Addressing his ejection, Trae Young said he was taking out his frustration regarding the officials for giving his team what he thought was a bad whistle.

title: Trump administration sues Maine over trans ban
content: The Trump administration announced a lawsuit Wednesday against Maine's education department for not complying with the government's push to ban transgender athletes in girls' sports.

title: FAMU to hire Heisman winner Ward as hoops HC
content: Former Heisman Trophy winner and first-round NBA draft pick Charlie Ward is set to become the coach at Florida A&M, sources told ESPN.

title: Ex-MLS forward dies following fall from 11th floor
content: Gabon forward Aaron Boupendza has died at 28 following a fall from the 11th floor of a building in China, the Gabonese Football Federation said.

title: Stars activate Seguin (hip) from long-term IR
content: The Stars activated center Tyler Seguin from long-term injured reserve ahead of Wednesday's regular-season finale at Nashville.

title: Bueckers: Investing in Unrivaled at 'a great time'
content: Paige Bueckers, who was picked by No. 1 overall by the Wings in the WNBA draft, says her investment in Unrivaled comes at "a great time to be in women's sports."

title: Michigan star 7-footer Wolf to enter NBA draft
content: Michigan's Danny Wolf, a projected first-round pick, told ESPN he will enter the 2025 NBA draft and forgo his remaining college eligibility.

title: Why Shedeur Sanders' NFL draft process, stardom are like nothing we've seen before
content: Too confident? Too famous? Here's what former Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders faced and why he's sure he'll succeed.

title: NBA experts' picks for the remaining play-in showdowns
content: Our experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: College football spring transfer portal: Live news, rumors and analysis
content: The spring transfer period is open, and we're tracking the latest news. Nico Iamaleava and Gio Lopez are among the top players available.

title: Bontemps' ballot: Final selections for MVP, All-NBA and every award
content: Who is the MVP? The top rookie? The Defensive Player of the Year? Tim Bontemps reveals his official awards ballot.

title: 'She can carry a franchise': What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? WNBA GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: Iran Close To Having A Nuclear Bomb, Says UN Body Chief, Heads To Tehran
content: Iran is dangerously close to developing an atomic weapon, warned the International Atomic Energy Agency, hours before the UN watchdog's chief is expected to leave for Tehran.

title: "Will Be Chaos": Supreme Court On Reopening Cases That Are Concluded
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said finality of a litigation is a core facet of a sound judicial system and a case that has concluded cannot be reopened, otherwise there will be "chaos in the administration of justice".

title: "I'll Marry Him": UP Woman Who Eloped With Daughter's Fiance
content: A mother from Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh grabbed the spotlight last week for all the wrong reasons. She eloped with her daughter's fiance ten days before the wedding.

title: SpiceJet Revival 'Going Very Well', Set To Double Fleet In A Year: Chairman
content: Domestic carrier SpiceJet's revival plan is "going very well" and the airline is on track to double its current fleet over the next 12 months, Chairman and Managing Director Ajay Singh said on Wednesday.

title: Truck Swerves To Hit Dog, Misses, Then Crushes Pregnant Canine In 2nd Try
content: A heart-wrenching video from Jaipur shows a pickup truck swerving to allegedly try and run over a dog and then crushing another pregnant canine to death.

title: Baarat  To Lock-Up: 4 Thieves Return To Village To Marry, Cops Spoil Party
content: They are notorious for stealing valuables at marriage functions in various states and resisting arrest through violence, but, Madhya Pradesh Police turned the tables on the infamous Kadiya gang by apprehending four members at their wedding.

title: "Let's Befriend Every Language": Top Court On Plea To Remove Urdu Sign Board
content: The Supreme Court recently held that the display of a language other than the official one of a State is not prohibited under any law in India, while dismissing a plea seeking the removal of an Urdu signboard of a municipal council in Maharashtra.

title: India To Expand Ties With Nations Offering Balanced Free Trade Deals: Piyush Goyal
content: India will expand its trade ties with nations that will offer fair, balanced and equitable free trade agreements (FTAs), Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday.

title: How Italy's Meloni May Save Europe From Trump Tariffs As All Others Fail
content: Currently the European Union has three months to convince Trump not to slap 20 per cent duties on all its exports to the United States, apart from the baseline 10 per cent tariff with another 25 per cent on steel, aluminium and autos.

title: Monk Becomes Victim Of Cyberfraud, Loses Rs 2.5 Crore Over 26 Days
content: The secretary of the Ramakrishna Mission Ashram in Gwalior, Swami Supradiptananda, became a victim of what is being described as Madhya Pradesh's biggest "digital arrest" fraud.

title: Top Court Issues Directions To Implement Rs 2 Lakh Cap On Cash Transactions
content: When there is a law in place, it has to be enforced, the Supreme Court said on Wednesday while expressing concern over the unsatisfactory implementation of provisions of the Finance Act 2017 which capped the limit of cash transactions to Rs two lakh.

title: Parliament Security Breach Accused Tried To Bring Back 2001 Memories: Cops
content: The police has told the Delhi High Court that an accused, arrested in the December 13, 2023 Parliament security breach case, had intended to bring back "haunted memories" of the 2001 Parliament attack.

title: 'I know how badly they want to win': How the Senators grew into being a playoff team
content: Ottawa is back in the postseason for the first time since 2017 -- with plans to make it an annual occurrence.

title: Onana to return for Man United vs. Lyon - Amorim
content: André Onana will return to the Manchester United team for their crucial Europa League clash against Lyon, head coach Ruben Amorim has confirmed.

title: Tevez targets Ronaldo, Messi for farewell game
content: Carlos Tevez wants former teammates Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to take part in his farewell game in Buenos Aires.

title: Kane: Penalty style inspired by Neymar, Balotelli
content: Harry Kane has said he adapted his penalty-taking technique after watching Brazilian forward Neymar and other high-profile spot-kick specialists.

title: Rashford's future undecided after Villa UCL exit
content: Unai Emery said the future of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford "depends on the next weeks."

title: Flick has to remind glum Barça: We're in semis
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said he had to remind his disappointed players they had reached the Champions League semifinal after Tuesday's 3-1 loss to Borussia Dortmund.

title: Linkin Park to play pre-match UCL final live show
content: UEFA have announced that Linkin Park will play a pre-match show before the Champions League final kicks off on May 31.

title: WPSL Pro launching as 2nd-tier women's league
content: The United States will soon have a second-division women's professional league for the first time. WPSL Pro plans to launch late next year as a second-tier league, the organization announced on Wednesday.

title: Luis Enrique: Semi-bound PSG world's 'best squad'
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique hailed his squad as the best in the world on Tuesday after they reached the Champions League semifinals with a 5-4 aggregate win over Aston Villa.

title: What comes next for the flailing Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading Kevin Durant.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Surprise teams, contenders and OU's quest to five-peat: Big questions for the rest of the softball season
content: Is anyone outpitching NiJaree Canady? Which teams are serious contenders? Bill Connelly dives into the 2025 college softball season thus far.

title: Plane With 12 Indians On Board Makes Emergency Landing In Kathmandu
content: An aircraft with 12 Indians on board on Wednesday made an emergency landing at the Kathmandu airport here after experiencing a hydraulic system failure.

title: India Set To Surpass China In Air Passenger Traffic In 2026: Global Council
content: India is projected to surpass neighbouring China in air passenger traffic growth rate in 2026, growing at 10.5 per cent, airports' grouping ACI said on Wednesday.

title: Youth May Not Join Army If Veterans' Resettlement Neglected: Supreme Court
content: Effective resettlement of ex-servicemen is necessary to keep the morale of serving members of defence forces, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said while ordering appointment of a woman who retired from the Indian Military Nursing Service.

title: Cab Company BluSmart Halts Services In Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru: Here's Why
content: Electric cab service BluSmart has temporarily suspended its operations in Delhi NCR, Mumbai, and Bengaluru. Although the app is available on the Play Store, it doesn't allow users to book or schedule rides until May 7.

title: Walmart Boosts Tech Presence In India With Chennai Office Deal: Document
content: Walmart has signed a deal for a second office space in the southern Indian city of Chennai, which is fast emerging as a major technology center after being known for years as a manufacturing hub.

title: Karnataka Governor Sends Bill For 4% Muslim Reservation To President
content: Karnataka governor has sent the bill giving 4 per cent reservation to Muslims in government contracts to President Droupadi Murmu for assent, saying that the Constitution doesn't allow for reservations based on religion.

title: UP Man Kills Mother After She Rejects "Condition" For His Love Marriage
content: A man allegedly stabbed his mother to death while she was sleeping in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The man wanted to transfer the house's ownership from his mother's to his name in order to marry a girl he has been seeing, the police said.

title: Previewing the NCAA gymnastics championships
content: Can LSU defend its title? Or will OU get redemption? What to watch as the NCAA gymnastics championships begin Thursday.

title: 2025-26 Way-Too-Early Top 25: Teams on the rise in version 2.0
content: Texas Tech and BYU climb our Way-Too-Early 2025-26 rankings thanks to key player returns and portal additions.

title: Why Aaliyah Chavez is no longer No. 1 in the final 2025 class rankings
content: The final high school player rankings saw big jumps -- including Jasmine Davidson taking over as the best player in the 2025 ESPN 100.

title: How Tennessee coach Josh Heupel scored one for coaches everywhere
content: By refusing quarterback Nico Iamaleava's NIL demand, Heupel and Tennessee took a stand for the good of the program.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Wirtz prefers Real Madrid over Man City move
content: Bayer Leverkusen star Florian Wirtz would join Real Madrid over Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who earned a spot, Volkanovski or Jandiroba?
content: There's a new featherweight champion and new strawweight No. 1 contender -- but just one is in ESPN's top 10.

title: Who will new featherweight champ Volkanovski fight in first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility?

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: How much patience should you have with slumping superstars?
content: Do April showers bring May...fantasy points? Some slow fantasy starts might lead to improved production.

title: Connor McDavid leads second round of EA Sports NHL 25 Team of the Season
content: The second batch of honorees has been announced, including the Oilers superstar, with one more group to come.

title: Low-Intensity Blast Triggers Panic In Manipur's Churachandpur
content: A low-intensity explosion triggered panic in Manipur's Churachandpur on Wednesday, officials said. The blast happened at Elim Veng near Jamsuan-Sahei roads junction, they said. No one was injured in the explosion, they added. Locals said some people came to the area at 1 am on a two-wheeler, threw the bomb, and left. The police said they have launched a search to find the suspects. Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world
